clusters.title: US law enforcement clashes with protesters after fatal immigration shooting
clusters.neutral_headline: ICE agent in Minneapolis killing identified as 10-year law enforcement veteran

items.title: US law enforcement clashes with protesters after fatal immigration shooting
items.standfirst: The White House said on Thursday US law enforcement was facing “organised attacks” after clashes in Minneapolis followed the fatal shooting of a woman by an immigration agent. Renee Nicole Good, 37, was killed as agents approached her car. Vice President JD Vance said, without evidence, the officer acted in self-defence.
items.content: The White House said on Thursday US law enforcement was facing “organised attacks” after clashes in Minneapolis followed the fatal shooting of a woman by an immigration agent. Renee Nicole Good, 37, was killed as agents approached her car. Vice President JD Vance said, without evidence, the officer acted in self-defence.

items.title: Former FBI official says fatal ICE shooting was "avoidable on several levels"
items.standfirst: Protesters are in the streets of Minneapolis after an ICE agent killed a woman on Wednesday. Chris Piehota, former FBI executive assistant director, joins "The Takeout" to assess the incident.
items.content: Protesters are in the streets of Minneapolis after an ICE agent killed a woman on Wednesday. Chris Piehota, former FBI executive assistant director, joins "The Takeout" to assess the incident.

items.title: ICE agent who shot and killed Minneapolis woman was part of special response team
items.standfirst: Protests are growing in Minneapolis over the killing of a woman by an ICE officer on Wednesday. CBS News homeland security correspondent Nicole Sganga is on the ground with the latest.
items.content: Protests are growing in Minneapolis over the killing of a woman by an ICE officer on Wednesday. CBS News homeland security correspondent Nicole Sganga is on the ground with the latest.

items.title: JD Vance says ICE officer who shot woman in Minneapolis "protected by absolute immunity"

items.content: Vice President JD Vance addressed the fatal ICE shooting at the White House press briefing on Thursday. CBS News' Anna Schecter reports.

items.title: Trump administration vehemently defends ICE agent who killed US citizen in Minneapolis – live
items.standfirst: Donald Trump, Kristi Noem, JD Vance and Karoline Leavitt repeat claims that federal agent acted out of self defense amid scrutiny of fatal escalationFBI takes over investigation of killing of US citizen by ICE officer and revokes Minnesota’s access to materialsICE agent in Minneapolis killing identified as 10-year law enforcement veteranSince early December, agents from Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), Customs and Border Protection and Homeland Security Investigations – many of them masked and brandishing rifles – have grabbed people at hardware stores and gyms, or outside homes and schools around the cities.They have violently tackled undocumented immigrants as well as US citizens, including advocates and protestors. Continue reading...

items.standfirst: The Minneapolis-based officer was part of an enforcement and removal operations special response team and had a decade of experience.
items.content: The Minneapolis-based officer was part of an enforcement and removal operations special response team and had a decade of experience.

items.title: ICE agent in Minneapolis killing identified as 10-year law enforcement veteran
items.standfirst: Court records point to Jonathan E Ross as officer in Renee Nicole Good’s death, amid protests and political falloutUS politics live – latest updatesThe ICE agent involved in the lethal shooting of 37-year-old Renee Nicole Good during an immigration sweep in Minneapolis on Wednesday is Jonathan E Ross, according to court records that closely match the description of a June 2025 incident involving the agent in Bloomington, Minnesota, cited by the homeland security secretary, Kristi Noem, and JD Vance. Ross is a Minneapolis resident and 10-year veteran of the special response team of ICE’s enforcement and removal operation.The death of Good, a mother of three, sparked outrage in Minneapolis and strident rebukes from Minnesota officials and on Capitol Hill. Thousands of people gathered in protest near the site of the shooting Wednesday night, and some Democrats on Capitol Hill have threatened to withhold funding to the Department of Homeland Security. Minneapolis mayor, Jacob Frey, said on Wednesday: “To ICE: get the fuck out of Minneapolis.” Continue reading...
items.content: Court records point to Jonathan E Ross as officer in Renee Nicole Good’s death, amid protests and political falloutUS politics live – latest updatesThe ICE agent involved in the lethal shooting of 37-year-old Renee Nicole Good during an immigration sweep in Minneapolis on Wednesday is Jonathan E Ross, according to court records that closely match the description of a June 2025 incident involving the agent in Bloomington, Minnesota, cited by the homeland security secretary, Kristi Noem, and JD Vance. Ross is a Minneapolis resident and 10-year veteran of the special response team of ICE’s enforcement and removal operation.The death of Good, a mother of three, sparked outrage in Minneapolis and strident rebukes from Minnesota officials and on Capitol Hill. Thousands of people gathered in protest near the site of the shooting Wednesday night, and some Democrats on Capitol Hill have threatened to withhold funding to the Department of Homeland Security. Minneapolis mayor, Jacob Frey, said on Wednesday: “To ICE: get the fuck out of Minneapolis.” Continue reading...

items.title: Fatal ICE shooting sparks protests in Minneapolis
items.standfirst: Demonstrators flooded the streets of Minneapolis overnight after a U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer fatally shot a 37-year-old woman on Wednesday, igniting anger among residents and local officials who were already upset by the Trump administration’s sweeping immigration enforcement operations in the city. Director of the Immigrant Lab and Associate professor at the American University in Washington DC, Ernesto Castaneda, explains further.

items.standfirst: The US, which recently captured its President Nicolás Maduro, has long demanded the detainees be freed.
items.content: The US, which recently captured its President Nicolás Maduro, has long demanded the detainees be freed.

items.title: Venezuela says it is releasing an 'important number' of political prisoners
items.standfirst: The government said it was a "unilateral gesture" to maintain peace; families of those imprisoned have been calling for their release.
items.content: The government said it was a "unilateral gesture" to maintain peace; families of those imprisoned have been calling for their release.

items.title: 'Trump does not speak of freedom but fundamentally of oil,' Venezuelan opponent Arria says
items.standfirst: In an interview with FRANCE 24, veteran Venezuelan opposition figure Diego Arria criticised US President Donald Trump's approach following the capture of President Nicolas Maduro by US special forces on January 3. "I was very concerned that the president does not speak of the recovery of freedom (...) of liberating the political prisoners, but speaks fundamentally of oil," he said.
items.content: In an interview with FRANCE 24, veteran Venezuelan opposition figure Diego Arria criticised US President Donald Trump's approach following the capture of President Nicolas Maduro by US special forces on January 3. "I was very concerned that the president does not speak of the recovery of freedom (...) of liberating the political prisoners, but speaks fundamentally of oil," he said.

items.title: Election Deniers Think the Venezuela Attack Is All About 2020
items.standfirst: Conspiracy theorists claim the capture of Venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro is proof that the Venezuelan government rigged the 2020 election in Joe Biden’s favor.
items.content: Conspiracy theorists claim the capture of Venezuelan president Nicolás Maduro is proof that the Venezuelan government rigged the 2020 election in Joe Biden’s favor.

items.title: Saudi Arabia says UAE helped Yemeni separatist leader flee as crisis deepens
items.standfirst: Riyadh says Aidarous al-Zubaidi, leader of the UAE-backed Southern Transitional Council, was helped to flee YemenSaudi Arabia has accused the United Arab Emirates of smuggling a UAE-backed separatist leader out of Yemen after he failed to turn up for crisis talks in Riyadh on Wednesday.The Saudi-led coalition in Yemen said Aidarous al-Zubaidi had fled the port city of Aden for Abu Dhabi under Emirati supervision, deepening a diplomatic row between Saudi Arabia and the UAE. Continue reading...
items.content: Riyadh says Aidarous al-Zubaidi, leader of the UAE-backed Southern Transitional Council, was helped to flee YemenSaudi Arabia has accused the United Arab Emirates of smuggling a UAE-backed separatist leader out of Yemen after he failed to turn up for crisis talks in Riyadh on Wednesday.The Saudi-led coalition in Yemen said Aidarous al-Zubaidi had fled the port city of Aden for Abu Dhabi under Emirati supervision, deepening a diplomatic row between Saudi Arabia and the UAE. Continue reading...

items.title: Yemeni separatist chief fled to UAE, Saudi-led coalition says
items.standfirst: Yemeni separatist leader Aidarous Al-Zubaidi has fled to the United Arab Emirates with Emirati help after a failed military advance that strained relations between the Gulf countries, the country's Saudi-led coalition said on Thursday. Al-Zubaidi was accused of high treason and removed from Yemen's Presidential Leadership Council on Wednesday.
items.content: Yemeni separatist leader Aidarous Al-Zubaidi has fled to the United Arab Emirates with Emirati help after a failed military advance that strained relations between the Gulf countries, the country's Saudi-led coalition said on Thursday. Al-Zubaidi was accused of high treason and removed from Yemen's Presidential Leadership Council on Wednesday.

items.title: US congressmen ask judge to appoint official to force release of all Epstein files
items.standfirst: Democrat Ro Khanna and Republican Thomas Massie seek to compel justice department to release full set of filesTwo US House of Representatives members have asked a federal judge to appoint a special master to compel the justice department to release all files related to Jeffrey Epstein, the disgraced financier and convicted sex offender.On Thursday, Democratic representative Ro Khanna of California and Republican representative Thomas Massie of Kentucky asked US district judge Paul Engelmayer to release the full Epstein files, as required by the Epstein Files Transparency Act. clusters.title: At least 13 killed in Israeli strikes on Gaza, including five children, civil defence agency says
clusters.neutral_headline: Israeli attack on Gaza tent kills at least three Palestinians

items.title: At least 13 killed in Israeli strikes on Gaza, including five children, civil defence agency says
items.standfirst: Attacks bring total number of Palestinians killed by Israel to 425 since October ceasefire took effectGaza’s civil defence agency said Israeli attacks in the Palestinian territory on Thursday killed at least 13 people, including five children, despite a ceasefire that has largely halted the fighting.Four people including three children were killed when a drone struck a tent sheltering displaced people in southern Gaza, agency spokesperson Mahmud Bassal told AFP. Continue reading...
items.content: Attacks bring total number of Palestinians killed by Israel to 425 since October ceasefire took effectGaza’s civil defence agency said Israeli attacks in the Palestinian territory on Thursday killed at least 13 people, including five children, despite a ceasefire that has largely halted the fighting.Four people including three children were killed when a drone struck a tent sheltering displaced people in southern Gaza, agency spokesperson Mahmud Bassal told AFP. Continue reading...

clusters.title: US House breaks with Trump to revive Affordable Care Act subsidies
clusters.neutral_headline: US House breaks with Trump to revive Affordable Care Act subsidies

items.title: US House breaks with Trump to revive Affordable Care Act subsidies
items.standfirst: Seventeen Republicans join Democrats to pass a three-year extension of tax credits cutting ACA premiumsThe US House of Representatives on Thursday passed legislation to re-establish tax credits that lowered premiums for Affordable Care Act (ACA) health plans, after a small group of Republicans broke ranks and joined with Democrats to defy Donald Trump on a key healthcare issue that could sway voters ahead of the November midterm elections.The chamber voted 230-196 to approve a bill that would extend for three years the credits, which were first created under Joe Biden but expired at the end of last year despite a concerted effort by the Democratic minority to continue them. Continue reading...
items.content: Seventeen Republicans join Democrats to pass a three-year extension of tax credits cutting ACA premiumsThe US House of Representatives on Thursday passed legislation to re-establish tax credits that lowered premiums for Affordable Care Act (ACA) health plans, after a small group of Republicans broke ranks and joined with Democrats to defy Donald Trump on a key healthcare issue that could sway voters ahead of the November midterm elections.The chamber voted 230-196 to approve a bill that would extend for three years the credits, which were first created under Joe Biden but expired at the end of last year despite a concerted effort by the Democratic minority to continue them. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Brazilian president vetoes bill reducing Jair Bolsonaro’s prison sentence
clusters.neutral_headline: Brazilian president vetoes bill reducing Jair Bolsonaro’s prison sentence

items.title: Brazilian president vetoes bill reducing Jair Bolsonaro’s prison sentence
items.standfirst: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva rejects bill passed by congress as he marks anniversary of 2023 Brasília riotsBrazil’s president, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, has vetoed a bill that would dramatically reduce the prison sentence of the country’s far-right former leader Jair Bolsonaro, who was convicted last year of plotting a coup.Lula vetoed the bill, which was passed by congress in December, on the third anniversary of riots by Bolsonaro supporters in the capital, Brasília, over his defeat by Lula in the 2022 general election. Continue reading...
items.content: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva rejects bill passed by congress as he marks anniversary of 2023 Brasília riotsBrazil’s president, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, has vetoed a bill that would dramatically reduce the prison sentence of the country’s far-right former leader Jair Bolsonaro, who was convicted last year of plotting a coup.Lula vetoed the bill, which was passed by congress in December, on the third anniversary of riots by Bolsonaro supporters in the capital, Brasília, over his defeat by Lula in the 2022 general election. Continue reading...

items.title: Brazil's Lula vetoes law reducing prison time for Bolsonaro
items.standfirst: Brazil's left-wing President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on Thursday vetoed a law that would significantly reduce the prison sentence of former far-right leader Jair Bolsonaro, who was jailed in November after being convicted of trying to cling to power in a landmark coup trial seen as a test of Brazilian democracy.
items.content: Brazil's left-wing President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on Thursday vetoed a law that would significantly reduce the prison sentence of former far-right leader Jair Bolsonaro, who was jailed in November after being convicted of trying to cling to power in a landmark coup trial seen as a test of Brazilian democracy.

clusters.title: Russia releases French researcher in prisoner exchange
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia releases French researcher in prisoner exchange

items.title: Russia releases French researcher in prisoner exchange
items.standfirst: Laurent Vinatier, had been sentenced to three years for allegedly violating Russia’s so-called 'foreign agent' laws.
items.content: Laurent Vinatier, had been sentenced to three years for allegedly violating Russia’s so-called 'foreign agent' laws.

items.title: Russia frees imprisoned French researcher Laurent Vinatier
items.standfirst: Russia has freed Laurent Vinatier, a French researcher serving ​a ‍three-year ​prison sentence for flouting laws requiring "foreign agents" to register with authorities. Vinatier will be exchanged for detained basketball player Daniil Kasatkin, accused by the US of hacking. Russian media reported that Vinatier had ​been pardoned by President Vladimir Putin. France24 Angela Diffley explains further.
items.content: Russia has freed Laurent Vinatier, a French researcher serving ​a ‍three-year ​prison sentence for flouting laws requiring "foreign agents" to register with authorities. Vinatier will be exchanged for detained basketball player Daniil Kasatkin, accused by the US of hacking. Russian media reported that Vinatier had ​been pardoned by President Vladimir Putin. France24 Angela Diffley explains further.

items.title: Russia frees French researcher Vinatier convicted under country's 'foreign agents' law
items.standfirst: Russia has freed Laurent Vinatier, a French researcher serving ​a ‍three-year ​prison sentence for flouting laws requiring "foreign agents" to register with authorities. Vinatier will be exchanged for detained basketball player Daniil Kasatkin, accused by the US of hacking. Russian media reported that Vinatier had ​been pardoned by President Vladimir Putin. Eliza Herbert and Laurent Berstecher report.
items.content: Russia has freed Laurent Vinatier, a French researcher serving ​a ‍three-year ​prison sentence for flouting laws requiring "foreign agents" to register with authorities. Vinatier will be exchanged for detained basketball player Daniil Kasatkin, accused by the US of hacking. Russian media reported that Vinatier had ​been pardoned by President Vladimir Putin. Eliza Herbert and Laurent Berstecher report.

items.content: Russia will free Laurent Vinatier, a French researcher serving ​a ‍three-year ​prison sentence for flouting laws requiring "foreign agents" to register with authorities.
